Although you’re past your prime,
you have such bright eyes, and such red
cheeks and such a happy expression
that you’re prettier than many a
young girl I know.
Yes, I am attractive - attractive,
nothing more.
Well, you're such a dear old lady and
I’m so fond of you and you've made
yourself so pleasant and agreeable that
rvhat I want you to do is — is to —
Is to what?
(GULPING) Is to go.
Go?
Go away. You see, they don't
appreciate you as I do. I think you're
a dear old lady - perhaps the dearest
old lady I ever saw, but they don't.
Oh, they don't.
No, I can't understand it, but it's so.
Now, I'm sure you're too proud, too
noble, too high-spirited to stay where
you're not wanted. /Aren't you, you
dear old lady? (KISSING THE OLD UEE)
-23-
